intro: Peltopus discolor, commonly known as the white-spotted nettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes other stinging nettles. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves with serrated edges, and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs that can cause skin irritation upon contact. Peltopus discolor is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
